result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Deferred Prosecution Agreement - count 3 - 3 years
Complete probation in 15CF285
The defendant shall not engage in any conduct which would lead an impartial magistrate to find probable cause exists to believe that the defendant has committed a violation of the criminal laws of the United States or the State of Wisconsin or of any ordinances adopting the same.
Have no direct or indirect contact with L.B.I. dob 6/29/99 or enter/remain upon any premises he has cause to believe said person may be present, unless authorized by probation agent.
Submit to, comply with and complete any counseling, assessments, treatment and/or AODA requested by Agent
If complies - dismiss
Non-compliance - formal sentencing
Bond continued
